DOC.brief_summary: The investigators postulate that F-18 florbetapir will show improved detection of cardiac amyloidosis over conventional non-invasive imaging techniques, particularly in early disease.
DOC.brief_title: The Role of F-18 Florbetapir in the Early Detection of Cardiac Amyloidosis
DOC.detailed_description: F-18 florbetapir is currently used for the early detection of brain amyloid (Alzheimer's disease). The hypothesis is that F-18 florbetapir will detect amyloid deposition in myocardium prior to current non-invasive diagnostic measures, particular electrocardiography with strain and technetium pyrophosphate scintigraphy. The investigators intend to use F-18 florbetapir and assess its correlation between standard non-invasive diagnostic modalities.
DOC.criteria: 1. Patients with extracardiac biopsy proven TTR amyloidosis (i.e. in the carpal tunnel) who have undergone TcPYP scintigraphy within the past 90 days. 2. Patients with light chain MGUS with a light chain ratio of >5 or free light chain difference of >50 who have an abnormal NTproBNP >125 or a detectable troponin T. 1. Contraindication to the tracer or its component. 2. Refusal to participate in the study.
